conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway: walls have height and thickness, multiple faces are visible with shading, and the ceiling/roof is removed to expose the interior from an elevated angled view.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion with readable wall thickness/height and clean corner geometry; cutaway is coherent. View is only mildly angled (still close to top-down), slightly reducing depth perception.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall layout matches: kitchen/dining left, living center/top, two bedrooms on right, bathroom bottom/center, laundry bottom/left, hall/entry central. Minor proportion/partition placement differences and door/opening placements are simplified/not explicitly modeled.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture present (dining set, living seating, beds), kitchen blocks and bathroom fixtures are included. Some room furnishing appears simplified and may not perfectly match room intent (e.g., secondary bedroom content).

visual_clarity.notes: Clean render with good contrast between walls/floors and clear interior visibility. No obvious broken meshes or UI/text contamination; materials are consistent and background is unobtrusive.

detected_errors.description: Doors are largely not shown as hinged door objects; openings are simplified, making exact door-wall verification incomplete.
Minor layout/proportion deviations in some interior partitions compared with the 2D plan (small shifts in wall lengths/room scaling).
Some furniture/room identity cues appear simplified or slightly mismatched (secondary bedroom furnishing not fully aligned with the 2D room intent).

summary: A true 3D cutaway conversion with strong overall layout fidelity and clear interiors, with minor proportional and door/opening-detail mismatches.
